DOC.brief_summary: The transradial approach coronary angiography angioplasty widely use catheterization laboratory worldwide , show advantage conventional femoral brachial approach due low incidence bleed cardiovascular complication . However , transradial approach seem suitable 5-15 % patient undergoing coronary angiography angioplasty . The ulnar artery one two terminal branch brachial artery usually large radial artery may potential approach cardiac catheterization . Recently , report demonstrate transulnar approach may feasible safe coronary angiography angioplasty selective patients.we perform study evaluate safety feasibility transulnar approach coronary catheterization real world non-selective patient .
DOC.brief_title: Safety Feasibility Transulnar Artery Approach Coronary Angiography Angioplasty
DOC.criteria: Clinical diagnosis coronary artery disease Needed perform coronary angiography angioplasty Arterial circulatory disease upper limb History deformity Forearm trauma Forearm amputate Hemodialysis Symptomatic peripheral artery disease Raynaud 's syndrome Hemorrhagic disease Cardiogenic shock Others unwilling participate study
